title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was two-fold. First, I was contacted by email to confirm my interest in the position. A virtual interview was scheduled followed by a tour and a secondary interview in person.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on remaining in the position if offered a job?

title: Housing Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: It was two quick behavioral questions, nothing stressful. The guys that interviewed me was really nice. I believe that because is not a really though job, the interview is easy as well.
Interview Questions: What are you future plans?

title: Foundation Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was a half day, individual, group and panel representing many departments and university units. Treated with hospitality and great energy and information . A great day . Everyone was nice
Interview Questions: Work related foundation related questions

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Excellent experience with nice people and welcoming environment to learn new stuff. It was a summer internship but got the experience of a full time job. Everything was nice. Wish I had more time there.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate for this job

title: Computer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Around 15 to 20 minutes, behavioral and experience questions. 5 people interviewing, 3 of them working in the manager position in the lab and 2 working in the manager position of student government
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with printing?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. After receiving an initial email of interest, I got a call from a professor in the program who was interested in me. Asked questions about my research background and studies. Pretty casual conversation in my opinion. The professor was nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to be a student.

title: Learning Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: First, I was contacted rather quickly for an initial interview (phone screening). That went well and I was moved on to submit a specific learning design activity. Following the build-out of this activity (mind you it took me several hours and days to complete), I was asked to interview with the search committee along with a few current learning designers. This interview took well over an hour-almost two. I was told they would be making a decision within the next week or two. Here I am almost 3 months later and no word. I assume I did not get the position but would like to receive a follow-up considering the amount of time I spent interviewing and creating a learning design activity. Hopefully, in the future, they can show a bit more respect during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What would you change in the activity you built out?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation to interview online quickly. It was a group interview. The questions were standard, the job was for a newly created position. They contacted me when I was not selected to continue.
Interview Questions: They asked about my research experience and my experience and philosophy mentoring students.

title: Engineering Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. I got the first interview by phone and the next one at the office. I was asked general questions about my resume and my availability.
Interview Questions: general question from my resume and my schedule

title: AD Programming Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Really straightforward and be prepared for questions about the position due to they will ask that for sure. Moreover the process took a while because many people applied for the position
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate for this position

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: They hire through a temp agency because it’s full time (40hrs/week) and most students can’t do it. If you get hired through the temp agency it’s more pay. It’s a more of a discussion to gauge your personality because they workers are all nice and relatively close with each other
Interview Questions: They ask about you and your experience and why you think you’d be able to handle the role or even contribute to their current system

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have professionally taken care of and had pleasant experiences talking to staff and faculty. The seminar presentation was adequately arranged with high attendance. The faculty was personally present to answer my questions, and the administrative staff was friendly.
Interview Questions: Why do you leaving Brown University and moving to the University of South Florida?

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager contacted me by email and asked if I could interview in person or remote.  We met in an office and went through basic scenario type questions.  They contacted me two weeks later with an offer.
Interview Questions: How have you overcome difficulties within a team setting?

title: Student Asisstant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy. Focused mostly on personality and social assessments. To prep I would recommend speaking to a current student and asking them what they are looking for in that position.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself in 3 words?

title: Oral History Transcriptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Asked a bunch of behavioral questions and then basic computer skills. The interview process is very short and everyone is very nice. It went by quick, just make sure you read the description to know what skills to highlight.
Interview Questions: How are your computer skills?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went pretty smoothly. Although I did not expect it to be too easy, I took lots of effort. Inspired and motivated CS undergraduate with a passion for developing innovative programs that expedite the efficiency and effectiveness of organizational success.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior project experience?

title: Front End Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Easy and simple interview process . Two step interview. Phone and in person. Was called next day with job offer. I declined the offer because I had accepted a different job elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult customer.

title: Sound and Light Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Normal behavioral questions. The interview was in a group. Just show that you are confident and try to answer first but don't be rude about it. Let them know you love working in a team.
Interview Questions:
3 strength and weakness
Tell me about yourself

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Virtual, scenario-based questions, interview with manager and provider.  Great energy, responds quickly. Be able to answer questions honestly and accordingly. Overall very welcoming atmosphere and not too demanding on questions.
Interview Questions: WHY DO YOU FEEL YOU SHOULD BE HIRED?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview takes place at teams meeting and we have 2 rounds of interviews.  Just some basic questions and your cumulative GPA.  and also your level and your major. This can also be applied online or face to face.
Interview Questions: What is your cumulative GPA

title: Leave of Absence Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Met with director and leave manager via zoom for 30 mins. Discussed role and expectations from new candidate, they went into detail about  the role, responsibilities along with the changes and new team they are looking to build.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit?

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: After I applied for the position I got initial screening call and scheduled my interview the same week. After the interview I received offer and on-boarding process took almost a week or so.
Interview Questions: Few questions on basic concepts of .Net, backend and application hosting and maintaining.

title: Graduate Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great for professional development, they were respectful and I felt like I was talking to genuine people. I thought the questions they asked to be refreshing and provided a good outlook on the day to day of the job that I was applying for .
Interview Questions: Strengths and Weaknesses, as well as questions about job-related scenarios

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was good, asked basic concepts basic concepts of .net and other frameworks. Few questions on backend and application hosting and maintaining. After the interview I got reply from team in less that a week.
Interview Questions: basic concepts of .net and other frameworks

title: Honors College Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a Microsoft Teams meeting with about 10 applicants ran by current peer mentors. During the meeting, they asked questions individually and had a few group exercises to judge capabilities.
Interview Questions: If a struggling student acted out in class, how would you work to resolve the situation?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was on microsoft teams, it was an hour long. It was very informative they offered a brief explanation on what they do and how they’ve handled the covid pandemic.
Interview Questions: What were strengths and weaknesses?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: In person group interview and a phone interview  in the beginning for screening. Had to wait for a few days before they got back to me. The interview was very straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: 1 screening interview, 2 interview with doctors. there overall process took 1 month. The first was a screening interview with the office manager who was very nice. The last two were with two of the physicians in the clinic
Interview Questions: what are your goals in 5 years?

title: Volunteer RA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted via Zoom and was very thorough. They asked primarily about my plans with pursuing research, as well as what my interests were. Very friendly and personable, made sure that it was a good fit for both.
Interview Questions: What are your primary research interests?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: virtual interview with three people. It wasn't a particularly difficult interview it is just a little jarring and felt like an interrogation.  It may just be my personality but I get really uncomfortable when it's hard to connect and the virtual environment wasn't helpful.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you were proud of completing.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Received case interview with data and asked to come up recommendations based on data. Four managers were present in each interview. Each of them asked multiple questions and questioned about final recommendations
Interview Questions: What was your recommendations and how did you come up with these recommendations?

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Takes a few weeks for the entire process to complete from beginning to end. Depending on the job and the department it may take months to complete. It usually begins with a phone interview and a face to face interview before you get an offer
Interview Questions: What is your experience in HR

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Indeed and received a phone interview in a matter of days. My interviewer was cordial and concise in his questions for me while at the same time easy going helping me thoroughly answer without being overly nervous. All in all, pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: How do go about beginning an application?

title: Tableau Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Previous experience, Tableau Experience, Database experience, Tableau questions, a presentation of one of my tableau projects. Highlighting my process of building it. More detailed questions about the insights i gathered through this and what effect did it yeild for my work
Interview Questions: Highlighting my process of building it. More detailed questions about the insights i gathered through this and what effect did it yield for my work

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process. Questions related to experience and desire for the role. Recommend familiarizing yourself with higher ed communications and media relations. Interviewed for multiple jobs at USF and some interviewers were more professional than others.
Interview Questions: Tell us about what you think makes for a good press release story.

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: This is a very friendly environment. Very quick interview that was less than 15 minutes. Conversation based interview. Definitely great interview process. Recommended for anyone looking to get into the health world
Interview Questions: What did you do at your last job?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was great. Pretty good one, It was a very comfortable environment. One of the easiest interviews i ever had given. It asked questions about professional development. Also seek some knowledge on my courses and software knowledge and experience.
Interview Questions: Experience with canvas, McGrawhill connecr

title: IT Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was generic and was based of prior experience, class work, and personal activities that I partook in. Multiple officers were present for the interview and they asked several questions on how I would handle situatuons.
Interview Questions: They asked about my pursuits within IT Services, and what courses I was taking

title: Public Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Required to submit resume and cover letter via email to manager then invited to in person interview. We were asked to create sample graphic and copy write for the interview as well.
Interview Questions: How would you react to a negative comment on our social media?

title: Student Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The professor just checks how good are you at that subject and participation in the class. He considered my performance in quiz ,midterm and final exam. The professor will make sure that , the assistant can assist other students.
Interview Questions: What  grade did I earn in that particular coursework

title: Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was good I matched there. Why won't it take me to the final page, I just wanted to be able to look at salaries and I already entered mine anonymously.
Interview Questions: What do you do for fun

title: Undergraduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process entailed situational questions and was very pleasant. There was around 6-8 questions, which discussed my prior experience. My interviewer was very nice and inviting. We discussed my goals for the position and given that I was near graduation, it was more difficult for me to find a student assistant position. Although, I got the position and loved my job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior experiences

title: Mechanical Engineering Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: To get the interview was easy, I had to have good grades on the classes that I wanted to tutor. I told my honors advisor to meesseage the head of department and introduce me.
Interview Questions:
What classes do you want to tutor?
What days are you available to work?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my resume and applied on the online career portal. Was emailed by the supervisor who then scheduled an in person interview. The interview was conducted by a panel of people.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you would approach a situation in which you have little experience in?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in April and received an email to schedule an on site interview in June. I went for my interview the next week. It was a 30 minute interview with two people who I would be working with if I got the position. I did not hear back until almost two months later.
Interview Questions: Followed a paper that had questions and they wrote the responses down. Nothing challenging.

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: After applying with the reference of a friend, I got a call for the interview after 2 weeks. Went to the interview with the printed job application and in a casual dress.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self?

title: Associate Director of Institutional Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Good people and a well planned interview day.  Treated to lunch and two good tours of campus. 
 Questions were reasonable and interviewers were engaging.  

Outcome was strange.  After a decent wait (2 weeks I think), I was told that the position was being reevaluated.
Interview Questions: Asked to prepare a presentation on my "vision" for the division.  Wasn't too happy about the ambiguity of that task.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 4 people on the first in person interview. One of the interviewers turned out to be the current employee who was promoted to the position. Found that to be very unprofessional. USF tends to hire these positions from within but because they are a public university they are required to post the job for 10 days and interview at least 3 candidates from outside their current employees. I have been one of the 3 candidates 4 times.  One interview they had a 5 page print out they went down with very typical boiler plate questions. It was agonizing only to find out that the hour long interview didn't matter because they already had the person the wanted to promote.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: it went well nice employers . Recommend bring your resume , having your elevator speech ready . It was short process. They were eager to learn about me and my skills
Interview Questions: what conflict have you resolved before?

title: Instructional Designer In the Information Technology Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and they gave me a call four months later. It was so long between application and call that I forgot about the position. 

The initial call was placed by one of the department’s assistants with the expressed purpose of setting up a 30-minute phone interview with the hiring manager. On the day of the interview, the hiring manager called me 25 minutes late. She “apologized” saying I was sandwiched between two of her meetings. Way to make a candidate feel special. We proceeded, but it was an incredibly difficult interview because  she could not string together a coherent sentence. Half the time, I was not sure what she was asking. 

Your tax dollars at work folks. Just unbelievable. I'd be lying if I said I was broken up about not receiving a call back or even a courtesy email to say they have moved on.
Interview Questions: Cannot remember one. Not surprising since half of them made no sense.

title: Student Athlete Enhancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick and typical interview questions, but be prepared. Very personable and easy to talk to. It was more of a conversation than an interview and they had about 5 preset questions they asked every candidate.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you faced a challenge in the workplace and what you did to solve it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I asked to interview for a research assistantship and had a meeting with the professor within the month. The professor asked me a number of questions regarding my background experience, education, and why I would want to join the project.
Interview Questions: What in your educational history qualifies you to take part in this research project?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Involved application with CV, example of research, statement of teaching philosophy, then full day on campus of teaching demo, interviews with faculty and staff. This was with the Honors college, which was particularly hands on and relational. The faculty was great, but the process is exhausting.
Interview Questions: If you are a song on the Honors college album, what song is it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a freshman and it was easy and comfortable, I was interviewed by two other employees of the USF Contemporary Art Museum including the Head of Security
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Communications & Marketing Officer (Multi-Media Journalist) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied beginning of Jan. 2019 and received a phone call two weeks later asking for an interview. They gave an option for in person or Skype.  I chose Skype.  Three admins and the other multimedia journalist were in the panel interview, which took 20 minutes.  About four weeks later, I received the rejection email (this was the timeframe they gave).  It was a positive experience even though I didn't get the job. The interviewers were nice and engaged (sometimes you get people who sound like they're not interested in interviewing you). They gave an approximate timeline of when they're making the decision and sent the rejection email, which doesn't always happen.
Interview Questions: What do you know about USF/ USF Health (where the position is)?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process. Called past employers, asked about past experiences, working events, proficiency in word, excel, powerpoint etc.  one on one interview with head of organization who was very kind and more interested in hearing about my ability to contribute/what I wanted to get out of it
Interview Questions: Past communication experience

title: Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: When I applied we had to just submit written answers to questions. There was no in-person or phone interview, which I heard has now changed. The questions were easy but I do suggest you take them seriously and think about how you can show that you are a unique candidate for this position and really understand how to convey your value as a candidate.
Interview Questions: They asked about what I believe makes great customer service. And more personal questions

title: Health Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I completed an online application then I interviewed with the Executive Director, Assistant Director, and secretary on a panel. The interview lasted about thirty minutes. The decision was sent out two weeks later
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Strength
Weakness
How do you cope with stress
How do you stay organized
How would you deal with an angry patient

title: Applications Developer II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted for 30 mins and concentrated on both database related questions and behavioral questions. Asked about my previous experience and problem-solving.  The interview lasted for 30 mins and concentrated on both database related questions and behavioral questions. Asked about my previous experience and problem-solving.
Interview Questions: What is Joins and Explain them?

title: Advisor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Three hours, meeting various groups, and lunch with questions. Scheduling was flexible, staff were pleasant, arrangements in advance for parking were helpful. Plan to arrive early, because parking and locating building will take up to 15 minutes.

title: Admin Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview - Questions were asked and answers were given. Then floor was open for questions.
In person interview - Group interview with all staff then with student employees. Questions were asked and answers were given. Then floor was open for questions.
Interview Questions: What do you think causes rape?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, it was a phone interview, for about ten minutes. Professor explained my main responsibilities. After I met with professor in person and got this position. It was very easy for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience; Are you able to do this job?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the hiring manager and with a brief discussion regarding background and job duties. Then a Zoom interview with a group of professors.  And then a follow-up phone interview to negotiating the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe your research interest  and experience in quantitative research

title: MBA Graduate Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met both the Office Secretary and I was going to share the office space with, MBA Program Manager as well as the Program Director during the process.  Everyone was very friendly and open.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself please.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions:
First stage: CV shortlisting 
Second Stage: Technical test  
Third Stage: Interview 1 with two of the Senior Analyst of the Department 
Fourth Stage: Interview 2 with the Director of the department 
Last stage:  Got an job offer
Interview Questions: Why do you want that position? What can you do for us? Do you use database management systems?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was an HR interview which happened over the phone. 
The second round of interview was a technical interview. This was also over the phone. The questions were relatively easy.
Interview Questions:
Tell us something about yourself.
How would you validate data?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was not prepared.  Kind of curt, cold. She thought I had traveled from out of state for the interview due to misunderstanding my phone number’s area code. Interviewer had more comments about my resume than questions. Was not a good fit for either party.
Interview Questions: How did you hear this job?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, try to give a glimpse into yourself, work history and academic goals. Being that it is a university, they are very interested in making sure your work and academic life coincide smoothly.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self?

title: Radiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was rushed and unprofessional. The staff at USF radiology don't seem to know what they are doing when it comes to hiring. I was not impressed with them or what they had to offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Fitness Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview of about 6 of us. We each sat with a person and answered their question. Sat with each interviewer for about a minute and saw 6 different interviewers. Once we were all done we were dismissed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the gym?

title: Executive Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The phone screen was very conversational and informal. The first in person interview was a panel style including a total of 4 interviewers. The second interview was with the leadership individuals (2 total) being supported by this open role. The process was going smoothly with swift and fluid contact between myself and the person coordinating the interviews. After I completed the final round interview, I waited a week and, when I heard nothing, reached out by email to see if a final decision had been made. No response. I can only assume now that I didn't get the role because no one ever called or sent an email advising me they decided on a different candidate. I found this to be extremely unprofessional. A simple email advising they went with someone else would've been appropriate, especially after the extent of my interactions with the coordinator throughout the process. It was very unprofessional in my opinion, even more so because this interview was with the Department of Academic Affairs, and I was interacting with individuals reporting directly to the Provost of the University.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult situation. What was it and how did you handle it?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was professionally conducted with a committee. The questions were in line with the position, and I felt welcomed and treated fairly. I was also contacted post-interview within 24 hours.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe my leadership style.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was conducted on the stipulated time. The overall process was easy and flexible.
The interviewers were very friendly and very professional while conducting the interview. Overall it was a very good interview.
Interview Questions:
Q. 1

Do you have any prior experience in Advising?

Q.2 Tell us about your past experience.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very short, general questions. Her main objective is to get to know you-- not to interrogate you. The supervisor is a very nice and caring woman so she was easily to talk to
Interview Questions: How does your experiences as a student help you in the position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty relaxed interview, asked about past experiences and their needs and expectations for the position. I was interviewed by the 2 professors who taught the online and in person sections for the class.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience as a teaching assistant in undergrad.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview. Phone interview included 3 staff members  and about 10 questions or so. In-person interview included 4 staff members  of about 10 questions or so.  Questions were designed to gauge experience, how you handle yourself in certain situations.
Interview Questions: What are 3 skills or abilities you feel that someone must have to work with a CRM?

title: Police Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Process was standard in regards to law enforcement interviews. The investigators were professional and make sure to explain all aspects of whats expected. I can assure you that they will discover more items in your past than most care to recall so just be honest. With most law enforcement agencies you can expect this process to last upwards of 6 months before you acquire an offer.
Interview Questions: They want to know about their demographics and population so do a little bit of research prior to your interview.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to create two different designs for my assessment test before actually speaking to anyone and to deliver it within 3 days. After they reviewed my work, I was invited to a phone interview with 3 ladies that went well and was invited to an in person interview a week later. There I interviewed with 4 people, then with the rest of the staff. Everyone was very kind and the interview was very relaxed. A few weeks later I was given an offer, which I accepted. While doing the background check, I was told HR didn't "believe" I had the amount of years experience that I offered to prove with physical work and invoices. My offer was ultimately pulled, but after I was told to pay my university any money that I owed and show USF's HR proof ($1000) within 24-48 hours of them pulling the offer. They were all over the place and whoever I was speaking through for HR was all over the place. The staff I would've been working with were great people, the HR just handled me poorly and I wouldn't of taken another offer even if they gave me one after dealing with them (HR).
Interview Questions: What is your design process?

title: Custodial Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
They go over a series of questions from a print out. They ask questions about how you handle several situations at previous jobs.
Do you have any experience with doing the job you've applied for. My interviewer was really nice.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience doing custodial work?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Group interview then individual interview. They had us do an interesting group activity. Then I did and interview with 2 different groups of people. Very relaxed and friendly environment. My individual interview was also relaxed. They just want t get to know you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I met with the program director for the interview.  Everyone was friendly, and questions were directly related to my qualifications for the job, my knowledge of the department, and my fit with their values.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you have faced before, and how did you deal with it?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for position and received phone call after one week to schedule a phone interview. Scheduler was very inflexible and only gave the option of one specific time on a specific day for an interview. Proceeded with phone interview where they asked basic questions like what qualifications do you have for this position and why do you want to work at USF. Interviewer did not seem engaged at all and was rattling off a list of questions one after another. Felt like a rapid fire interrogation more than an open conversation. Received a call a few days later to schedule an in-person interview but once again was only given the option of one time slot on a specific day. In-person interview lasted about an hour consisted of a panel interview with 3 professors and a separate interview with the department head and supervisor for the position. I was told I would be contacted the following week with a response of yes or no. 4 weeks later and I haven't heard any response and emails go unanswered. Very unprofessional experience. My suspicion is that I merely was an interview used to make the hiring process seem competitive when in reality they already knew who they wanted to hire for the position. It is very common in higher education for all positions to be pre-selected and interviews being held to make the process seem legitimate and legal.  I was also advised by interviewer that since it is a state position there would be no opportunity for promotions or pay increases. Don't waste your time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at USF?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a Skype interview. Second, interview was in person on the USF -St. Pete Campus. The interview on campus was four hours long and included a tour with a student.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very long  and drawn out process, did not seem to move in a timely manner. Seemed very professional at first but as time went on seemed to really cut corners and round edges for the process. Gave me information about other applicants that was unnecessary. Overall, I felt like I was not a good fit for the company and decided to take a job elsewhere
Interview Questions: Do you think you can create a budget and stick to it, while still leaving room for emergencies without breaking your budget

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by two people; the overall supervisor of the library and the supervisor of the library assistants. They were lenient with my school schedule and gave me me an offer 2 days after interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you addressed conflict with a coworker.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Many people shoved in a small room. Job duties not on job description.  Bickering happening in room. You can tell  right away if they don't like you. Qualifications aside.  Awful interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview for a behavioral health internship.  It was a simple interview to get to know you. They were interested in making sure that you were the right fit for the internship, that you were applying for.
Interview Questions: Why you wanted to intern there?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online and Submit a video resume answering some basic questions on why do you feel that you are a good fit for a Graduate Teaching Assistant position.

The application is then selected based on your GRE & TOEFL scores as well and then the called upon if selected.
Interview Questions: Familiar with the concerned technologies?

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Leadership skills were asked. Explain experiences with other students. Have you ever tutored other students? very comfortable setting, did not feel nervous a all. The hiring person is very friendly.
Interview Questions: Any experience with tutoring?

title: Orientation Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial stage of answering four essay questions online and then the next stage was having three group interviews and then one-on-one interviews. The interviews basically just tested our communication skills and how we would do in difficult situations when talking to a new student
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for this position

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: NOTHING FANCY. As long as you can do your job well and shows that you have the ability to be a tutor, you are fine. First you get email ask about you available time and meet with boss.
Interview Questions: What is the different between a tutor and a teacher?

title: Clinical Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview with the clinical coordinator and the primary investigator that would be involved. There were a few other people coordinating the details of the interview. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and everyone was very friendly at the interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were mainly about experience

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took a while to hear back after giving my information but once it happened it happened The interview was short and to the point. As a scientist something I enjoy.
Interview Questions: Mostly about my science background and what technologies i was fmailiar with

title: Assistant Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring Manager conducted a 30 minute phone screen.  Interview was an hour with 3 members of the unit.  Overall, I was unimpressed with the entire  on boarding process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience at previous academic institutions.

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview with the Associate Director, which took about 30 minutes. Questions were straight forward, and all of them were related to the job/position. A week later I was contacted for an in-person interview. First I met with the Director of the Department, then I met with the Associate Director and one of the Research Administrators. The whole process took about 3 hours. The questions again were job-specific, but this time there were some personality related questions, such as: "How would you tell another research professional that the quality of their work is poor without offending them?" and "How would you feel about giving a presentation to a group of 20-50 people?" After my interview, they informed me that they had a few more candidates to interview but a decision would be made in about one week, and they said they would let me know once the final decision was made. I wrote my thank you letters to each interviewer, where I reiterated my interest in the position and again mentioned that my background and experience aligned with the position requirements. Weeks went by and I never received a response, not even an automated e-mail with the oh-so-generic "Thank you for your interest, but at this time we have decided to...(we all know how that goes)." I was particularly disappointed because the interview process was very time consuming, so a generic e-mail would have been the professional thing to do on their part.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time where you encountered conflict with an investigator and how you handled it.

title: WUSF Membership Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online through the system and approximately a month or so later I was contacted to come in for an interview. After describing my time working in Development and strategies used to enhance the membership program at prior employers, I was then introduced to every member of the department. This turned into a series of interviews with every person who worked in the department. The entire process went extremely well, and ended with the director saying, "I think you would be a good fit here."

Fast forward to two months later, after sending the initial thank you notes following the interview I had heard nothing back. I sent an appropriate email asking if I was still under consideration for the position and received no response. The hiring manager never responded and eventually I received a standard email from HR indicating I hadn't been chosen. 

A year later after accepting a position elsewhere working in Development, I floated a resume with WUSF on the annual giving team for a new position. When I was contacted for an interview by the same director in the membership department from the previous year, I declined to respond. The negative experience I previously had with the specific director and lack of professionalism let me know that perhaps WUSF was not going to ever be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with mass mail campaigns.

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Great and super easy. I was set up for a next day interview. I wasn't asked a ton of nonsense questions like. "Tell me about a time when.." It was more about my qualifications, work history and based on my personality.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Standardized Patient Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online 2 weeks later had my first interview over the phone. then had a second interview, It was more like a casting., 3 people were in the room besides me. It was Really fun and different, A week before the interview I would get a script that I will be acting out.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Mostly personality based questions. You are interviewed by an RLC and an RA. Most important part was confidence and showing your college experiences. I enjoyed that it was conversational and pretty low in pressure.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a failure

title: Academic Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by e-mail and phone within 24 hours of application deadline to interview in person with a selection committee comprised of the chair, the incumbent, and two other administrative staff for the department. The interview was scheduled for the next available business day. The interview itself was less than 30 minutes and was scripted to be conducted in a "round robin" manner. Upon conclusion of the interview, I was informed that interviews would continue for the remainder of the week and that the successful candidate would be notified by the beginning of the following week. Within two business days I received a rejection e-mail. Interestingly, at around the same time I received the rejection, the department's administrative office posted the position of the only primary staff member *not* included on the search committee. The sense of my interview being for show while the successful candidate had been prearranged is unpleasant, to say the least.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you work on a team.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is intense. Prior to the interview you have to complete a quiz to determine your current expertise for the position. Then the interview is a group setting with your potential team members interviewing you.
Interview Questions: Walk me through the one of  the research protocols that you manage from start to finish.

title: Academic Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic question, semi-relaxed. Four employees were present and all of them asked 1-2 questions each. The interview wasn't a drawn out process and they allowed me to ask questions. I felt as if they already had who they wanted to hire in mind. I answered all my questions truthfully. They seemed to have wanted some one long term for a entry-level position.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous job duties

title: Help Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Saint Petersburg, FL)
Interview Descriptions: You will sit down with the department head, one on one, and will be asked a series of questions. This all occurs after you apply online (USF System only lets you apply online). I was not required to interview with anyone else. The questions are the basic type you get at most interviews but more centric to technology. (Explain how you handle an irate customer over the phone. Explain types of questions you would ask a customer to figure out what the real issue is with their computer. Do you know what NIC imaging is? Have you used Remote Desktop client services?)
Interview Questions: A customer calls in and states that their unable to access their email. Explain the type of questions you would ask them to trouble shoot the issue.

title: Desk Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview that took about 15 minute and it was myself and two other persons that asked questions back and forth about situations and how I would have handled these situations.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you helped resolve a conflict

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were friendly. The questions were very basic and typical ones you find on google. Lasted 15 minutes and they gave a decision within a week. There were two people who took the interview. Make sure you appear friendly and have a smile on your face. It is a very easy process.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation at your previous job and how to handled it.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. had an interview within 5 days.
around 15 students were shortlisted and got th results within 4 days
the questions were mostly behavioral and also some technical
one question was how would i add value to the team and also any suggestions to the existing process
Interview Questions: how do you add value

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal and laid back. It was held in the professors office. The professor basicly wanted to get to get to get to know me and know how well I thought I could do the job after the responsibilities were explained to me. I was told to get the job I needed to perform better on the final than the other applicants. About a week after the final exam the professor congratulated me on doing very well in the class and I was sent a letter of offer.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been a teaching assistant or tutored students before?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from one of the advisors in the college of engineering; it was sent to many other students. The email was about an open position as a tutor in the engineering building (specifically ENG). The interview was a conversation about what classes I felt comfortable tutoring. Hired on spot as I am sure most who interview are.
Interview Questions: What do you feel comfortable tutoring?

title: Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward with a direct interview with the faculty with whom you wish to work. If he/she likes you, your on board. No HR interviews for the Graduate Assistant position. Mostly PhD students are likely to get call for it, or unless or until you have a relavent working experience with a certain company
Interview Questions:
Tell about your achievements during undergraduate?

Tell about your final year project?

Tell about for research interest and where do you see working in next  5 years?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Five weeks after applying for the position, I received a call to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was typical interview questions. After the phone interview, I received a call back for a personal interview. It was a 2 hour interview - 1 hour with immediate supervisor (tour, job responsibilities, benefits etc), 30 minutes with dept staff and 30 minutes with faculty representatives. Even though I was not offered the job, a good experience.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions for the position.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. She asked me about my prior work history and asked me what kind of skills that I acquired that would be useful in this job setting.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your previous job?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (State College, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour phone conversation about research interests and experience, then a reference check with graduate school advisor (this was the part that took the most time), followed by an unofficial offer via phone and then offer letter in the mail upon my request
Interview Questions: What research are you currently working on?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: When I applied to the PhD program, I was accepted and they paid over $500 so I could fly down to Tampa to visit campus and meet the professors. Usually when they accept you, a professor already has in mind that they'd like to work with you. It's a bit political so you need to tread lightly if you're not interested in what they're researching.
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions, just the online application.

title: Financial Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. They wanted a copy of resume. They asked questions about what I was looking for in a new employer. What my expectations were for a new job.
Interview Questions:
What kind of experience do you have?
What kind of general ledger programs have you used in the past?
What is you knowledge level do you have with Microsoft?
What kind of projects did you work on?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, basic questions and short.  I knew I was the only person that they were interviewing for the position, so it was very easy.  Though I knew that I was the only person that they were considering, it took a very long time to interview me.  It took several weeks.  Throughout USF, it can be a very slow process.
Interview Questions: If your supervisor and you Dean asked you to do a task, but both had to be due on the same date, which one would you give more priority to?

title: Mobile Applications Developer Interview

It was good and they asked very basic questions. 
If you are true mobile application developer, just concentrate on the basics of coding.
They'll test your capability in developing a complete application.
Interview Questions: Asked me to develop a sample mobile application

title: Administrative Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was contacted via email and phone to set up a Skype interview.  The interview included three people and lasted about 1 hour.  The interview questions were traditional questions to be expected for this type of position. The process took about 2-3 weeks from submitting application to interview and offer.
Interview Questions: What is your role on a team?

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Better know someone to get a job that pays at usf.  Interviewer not prepared and lacked questions.  Was not asked any normal frequently asked interview questions but things pertaining to my abilities and confidence.
Interview Questions: What was my learning style?

title: Enrollment Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Originally, I had a phone interview for a different position. Then, they contacted me for an in-person interview for a position that they thought I would fit best. The interview was like a panel, I was at the end of the table and there were approximately seven other people. Each one of them asked me general questions.
Interview Questions: Is there something interesting about you that you would like to share with us?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: From the email and waiting for face to face interview. They just ask some easy questions and ask me to explain why should we hire you? I anwered the question and solve some test problems.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview went good so far. They asked general question for the interview, was easy not hard at all.I been asked what is your weakness and strength?  and other question i dont remember The interviewer were friendly. I was so strees out
Interview Questions: When would you like to start? What is your strength ? and weakness?

title: OPS Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Most positions here are filled by word of mouth. Generally they need workers that will work great with the other employees and will often times defer to a recommended employee over an outside applicant. A typical interview will be the basic questions with the manager and possibly the Assistant Director depending on the position. If you are interviewing for a programming position you will be asked to create a small program or to debug some code to prove that you really understand at least the basics to programming. Afterwards you will get to visit your potential co-workers and different persons you may work with. Depending on your interview and recommendations you will then have to take care of the HR side of things. These involve actually applying for the position posting, drug screening, finger printing and a background check.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question(s) typically came from some specific function from MS Excel using a function to compute data. The way it was worded I was dumbfounded as to what I was asked to verbally describe in Excel.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I was asked questions about prior experience, what I liked the most about marketing, and questions about the resume itself. The interviewer was very friendly, which makes you feel comfortable and speak with flexibility
Interview Questions: all of them were very easy questions

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: First of all, one of the committee members sent me an email and ask some questions which were vague for them regarding my resume. After clarification, the invited me to interview and ask me some key questions and general idea behind my master research.
Interview Questions: What is teaching strategy to maximize the output of your class?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, send the doc, they reviewed it on time, got the initial email, got an interview schedule over skype and phone, asked few questions related to background and interest, the interviewer seemed intersted, got the offer letter, came, joined and still working
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this school?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Three encounters - one with hiring manager, one with hiring manager's up line and one with VP of division. The actual process was fairly typical and there were few surprises. The hiring manager's assistant, who sat in on the meeting, kept us waiting almost 15 minutes and then slumped in a chair scrolling through her cell phone messages rather than participating in the interview. Her only comment to me was that she was surprised I'd want to work at USF. The actual process, from interview to offer, however, was not difficult or out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I knew most professors at USF. Recommendations were not hard nor bad.
I was lucky to be referred by one of the employee.
The interview itself was not hard. Learning the job afterward is what was most challenging
Interview Questions: When can you start

title: Bursar's Office/Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for interview online, received a call about a month later. Went in for interview, when I asked them what their ideal candidate looked like, they explained someone with experience handling money, etc. Though I did not possess the experience at a similar job, I did have the education and the qualifications they listed seemed like an easy thing to do and things you do in everyday life. The interviewers were nice but said this was the second time they posted the job since no candidates met their expectations in the past. Though I would love to work at USF, I find their expectations for a job whose qualifications and experience are not hard to get and learn, and which only pays 23K a year, to be unrealistic and somewhat of a turn-off at times to working at USF, as I have found from my many interviews there that it is very hard to get in, despite of your qualifications. The interview questions were the typical: why should we hire you, your strengths, weaknesses, a few situational questions, etc. 
Last thing, when asking for a timeline and following-up with a thank you or whatnot for an interview, do not expect an answer or to provide any feedback. I think they said they would let people know if they didn't get it, either way I never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Situational questions, why should we hire you above others.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Once you are called in for an interview , they generally go over your resume and ask questions pertaining to your prior experience and ask you if you have any knowledge of the work you are expected to do if selected.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best suit for this position ?

title: Media Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process can be unnerving! Often it is a group panel and they have a list of questions and rate you on your answer on a piece of paper while you are sitting there. Each department is different but it seems the rate-while-you-watch thing is pretty common. Interview questions generally are pretty normal (i.e. what are your strengths/weaknesses)
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

total of 8 rounds a) why  it is not always possible to meet the setup and hold criteria
