title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had to come in with all documents and arrived early, something that my the interviewer was pleased to see. The interview was more like a discussion and was conducted in a relaxed environment. I was asked about my experiences and why I thought I was a best fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a professor at the USF. The overall interview was pretty easy. Most of the interview questions were behavioral questions.  Not much difficult technical question. I got an offer 2 days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a valuable asset to our project?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: After I applied on the university's employment website, I waited 4 weeks before I received a call for interview. Interview was simple with basic interview questions such as what are your strength & weakness, why do you want this job etc. I was interviewed by 3 people and the interview only lasted about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses

title: Temporary Bookseller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through USF@Careers. I received an invite for a group interview. It was a group interview. Including myself, there were 8 applicants and our potential supervisor. 
Basic interview questions. The interviewer was more interested in how you reacted being on-the-spot.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple tasks at once?

title: Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I had a chance to interview with the department head about 3 months before my acceptance to the school and about 10 months before my actual start date. This was actually my only interview, I believe because he had a substantial power in the department. Their processes were very timely. Information flow was a little bit not at my desired level but it can be seen acceptable considering the communication between US and Turkey.
Interview Questions: I was asked what type of research I am currently doing or what my long term plan is regarding research and my further career.

title: IT Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application with your resume and cover letter on the USF Careers website, you will receive a phone call asking you to meet with 2-3 individuals. One being the manager, and 1-2 others being senior employees / higher-management.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between HTTP and HTML?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Once a student, it's easier to see what postings are available. You apply online and if selected you come in for an interview. I found the interview process very simple and straightforward. They simply asked about my history, relevant experience and my interest in the job. I had two interviewers who represented different aspects of the job that I was being hired for. They consequently focused on different skill sets, one on my past experience with planning events and the other on my research skills.
Interview Questions: What are your personal research interests?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Either one or two managers will interview mainly to introduce oneself and the customer service skillets; need to have good communication skills. it is preferable to apply in the 1st year so that can work longer in this position.
Interview Questions: how will you serve customer?

title: Technology and Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: Long hiring process. Interview are multiple and patience is a virtue
Interview Questions: What expectations you ahve from the position

title: Health Promotion Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the department director first and then was flown out to interview and present to the full departmental staff. On the morning of the interview, I met one-on-one with the director, followed by a presentation that was open to campus partners.  That was followed up lunch with the department and then a group interview with the department. Lastly, I received a driving tour of campus and was then driven to the airport.
Interview Questions: Please tell us one thing that challenges you in a working environment.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Depends on who the interview is with. One was with a person who was curt and rude, while she had great accomplishments she was belittling me during the interview process. While the interview I had with the group I worked with was with three very warm and nice people who cared about making a difference in the community.
Interview Questions: What do you love about (insert your field here)?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: This was one of the most confusing interview processes. I believed that I was going in for a one on one interview session or a group interview for a long term position working at the university bookstore. The interview started off with an hour of information regarding the position, which was detailed as part-time and only temporary due to the increase of customers during the beginning of the semester. During this whole part, it was a group of people sitting around a projector like it was a lecture. I don't know if this is a common method of interviewing a group but it was a strange method.
Interview Questions: The only unexpected aspect was the questions regarding whether I would be alright with being a temporary worker. I walked into the interview thinking that it was a part-time long term position. I guess there was a lack of communication on the employer's and my part.

title: Set Up Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: I apply online, then get an interview request by the employer. They schedule me an interview about 30 minutes and we talk about our work ethics, why I want to get the job and how can I fit their culture. The second interview is a panel, you have to answer everyone's questions at once.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you have to do something you don't like

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was an easy interview overall.  It was not a panel but there were two people in the room.  They asked typical interview questions in an very non-intimidating environment.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Tedious, took months and included 1 phone interview, 2 panel interviews and 1 final interview.  It then took about 3 months to get the offer completed.  This was the most tedious interview experience I have ever been subjected to and it continues.
Interview Questions: What drew me to the advertisement for Manager

title: Front Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Great Inteview, was given a tour of the office afterwards. I met all the people who worked there and I saw what each department does. I got a lot of feedback from the people there. I also saw the system they use to manage reservations, It was a very informative interview and I found out I got the job a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process involved two Interviews.  This job has multiple bosses and multiple projects simultaneously occurring.  However, the interview process for a technician appears to be conditional to the hiring lab.  Some labs may require a skills test and/or knowledge test based on specific experimental procedures necessary to certain projects.
Interview Questions: What are my plans for two years from now?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: as a phd student , the teaching assistant is based on what you learned before and how you learned before. It requires communication skill because you need teach class and discuss with student that student can easily understand what you say. Besides that, you have strong academic ability. If you don't know the knowledge how can you educate and help others
Interview Questions: How you present statistics to someone who never learn statistics

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had to interview with 5 professors separately and give a presentation of my previous research work to the department. They asked me about career plans, to describe past work and the current literature in this field.
Interview Questions: What is your career plan? Describe your past research? Why are you interested in this lab?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was first called over the phone, i was asked about my resume and whether or not i had references to submit.  Nothing much about salary was discussed over the phone but i was asked about the length of employment i was looking for.  At the actual interview it was more formal than i expected, i was shown around the facilities and asked about my experience in different techniques.
Interview Questions: Probably the most unexpected conversation was regarding the professors actual research, not much of it was published and i was new to the field.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Florida
Interview Descriptions: When you go in for an interview expect to go on more than one. Student assistant jobs are pretty popular around the campus. There will be jobs that they will find you right for, some will just not be right for you. So just apply to everyone that you seem to like.
Interview Questions: What is your most valuable quality?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Slow, bureaucratic, too much drama, very bad organized. Horrible facilities, bad questions, ridiculous staff panels, intimidating with staff that is either new or never had a job what a joke
Interview Questions: So many questions from amateurs that had been on the job less than a year

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Do not interview here! 
1. They dont know how to interview. So many illegal questions were asked! Office secretaries trying to talk salary and benefits! 
2. sneaky and uncomfortably personal questions!
3. Offering unsolicited advise to find out where all the candidate has applied!!
The Director of the School lied in writing over emails on how no one was being hired! and then hired 3 people from the search! 
4. Nobody was prepared. Nobody had read the CV. people constantly got my qualifications and schools wrong!
Interview Questions: You have been exceptionally successful to date. Whats your biggest weakness?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit an application along with student records. I then met with potential professors and other students. The offer was extended a couple months after the interview. Getting admitted depends on how many other applicants there were in the process as well as how you compare academically against those applicants.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals in the department?

title: Web Developer/Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical of universities, it took quite a while for the interview process to be completed.  It was done very professionally and thoroughly.  There were lots of technical questions, so you have to know your stuff.
Interview Questions: Why should USF hire you?

title: Scientific Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: It's not very hard. Depending on the department and the interviewer. Most professors like to meet with the potential incoming grad student, a tour of the labs/facilities is usually given and depending on funding, an offer may be given.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research in XYZ?

title: Medical Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone interview with the hiring supervisor and office manager. The second interview was scheduled 3 days after that phone interview. The in person interview took place at the college of medicine, be sure to ask for directions to any location on that part of campus. Also be sure to ask for a parking placard or you will get booted. Round robin of interviews with supervisor, faculty, and staff. Each had approximately 20 minutes with me. Staff asked the great questions, the supervisor determined the candidate to hire. The faculty seemed  more interested in giving a history of what the position had entailed and what prior people had done.  With room changes and people changes, it took a few hours.
Interview Questions: They gave me a run down of the position and asked where my strengths and weaknesses would come into play.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant for Statistics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Received an email regarding open teaching assistant positions as I had subscribed to the department mailing list. Applied for the same and received an interview request  which was a face to face interview. Simple technical questions on probabilty & hypothesis testing were asked as part of the interview process. Brushing up on important stats concepts prior to the interview will help.
Interview Questions: Part of a graph shaded, find the probability of the shaded region.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interviews on the phone and then interviewed by two department staff members. once the interviews were complete they called me back within two day to let me know if the times i had available would fit into the hours they needed a worker.
Interview Questions: The primary questions asked were about the students ability to deal with office hours.

title: Network Administrative/Senior Tech and Sys Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very nerve wracking; I was a temp and it took them months to decide if they wanted to make me a permanent employee.  I was desperately looking for another job in the process.
Interview Questions: I had already been working the position for seven months; they interviewed me like I just walked in off the street, other employees should be aware and ready for this.  It was unexpected that they started from ground zero.

title: Academic Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I was initially contacted by email to set up an on site interview. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and was one on one with the Director (direct reports to). 

The questions were very standard interview questions, behavioral in nature.

Describe your greatest weakness/strength. What are you doing to help your weakness?
3 words to describe yourself.
Tell me about a time when you had to deliver bad news to your supervisor, how did you handle the situation?
Interview Questions: The question was not unexpected, but it was difficult because it related to a software system this position would use heavily that I had no experience with. The system is not widely used and it wasn't expected that many (if any) candidates would have knowledge of the system, but answering honestly was key.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: interview was over the phone and had little to do with the position. It seemed they were much more interested in just making sure I could cover the obscure hours they require to work.  They also were very limited in answering question about ability to teach the course the way you want.  They seemed to just want you to teach the slides provided, no more, no less.
Interview Questions: What hours can you work?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, typical interview questions. Why do I want to work there, where do I see myself in 5 years, what are my academic goals for the future. Skills assessment towards the end testing familiarity with Excel and certain formulas. The interview was for a limited, 3 week project but after expressing my interest in working there and proving my capabilities, an ongoing contract position was offered.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Academic Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I reported directly to the department that I was interviewing with were I met with the Chair of the department and two other employees that I would be working with. They took turns reading questions form a pre-printed question sheet and took notes while I gave my answers. The process took approximately 35 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to make an important decision at work and you were completely on your own. How were the end results of your decision.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by in-person campus visit for 2 days. Research presentation, meeting with faculty members, administrators, and students. Campus tour. Lunch and dinner with departmental faculty members. Overall, everyone was pleasant and courteous, and had a lot of interesting conversations.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to (institution name)?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had in person discussion with my manager about the position. It was on round technical interview on SQL Server, SSRS, .Net Framework and one behavioral round. It was easy for me to answer the questions as I had worked on these skills for more than 3 years.
Interview Questions: To write a query using cursor to insert two new rows in a table having identity column in it, without making any changes in identity column sequence.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the University and found a professor I wanted to work with.  He just wanted to test my basic understanding of simple scientific principles.  The process was easy and fun; I just sat down for a very informal meeting with him where he asked some generic science questions.  I also chatted about my hobbies and what kind of research topics I was interested in.  He also asked what kind of additional funding I could potentially secure.
Interview Questions: Can you cool a room down by opening a refrigerator door?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had previously consulted with the hiring manager and was known to her professionally. When the position became available, a shared colleague suggested a fit. The hiring process began with a quick conversation about the role. After completing an application, I was invited to participate in a telephone interview. The interview included a small committee. I was asked to come in for a small-group interview process.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions dealt with procedural matters...

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the major profession whom I was going to be working for. They asked for GPA, and had asked to take GRE exam. My grades are in order so the only thing in between me getting a graduate position was the GRE exam upon which my acceptance into USF program depended.
Interview Questions: GPA

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I Emailed a professor that I thought had some interesting research topics and met with him. He asked me about my previous experience and what projects I have been involved with. After touring the lab and showing me the projects available I was able to start that week.
Interview Questions: What previous research and/or projects involved with

title: Equipment Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The questions were quite detailed to make sure I had the technical knowledge to perform the job duties. Also to  ensure working and getting along with other people is important.
Interview Questions: Can you get along with difficult people and how do you overcome the attitudes?

title: Purchasing Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was about three months
Interview Questions: The interview was passive and was not hard or challenging.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contacted quickly after submission of application materials; interview was comfortable, not rushed, allowed me to ask numerous questions regarding the position requirements, duties, and responsibilities; application process was efficient; new employee orientation was comprehensive and included extensive information regarding all benefits, eligibility timeframes, and other related resources; hiring authority contacted me via telephone to offer the position and was understanding when I informed her that I would like 2 days to consider it
Interview Questions: From your understanding of the position as we have discussed, what would be the most difficult duty or responsibility for you to successfully accomplish?

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I felt the interview went well and because I had a higher degree than the job required must have been the reason that I did not get called for a second interview. It is a difficult job market everywhere these days and being over-educated for the positions that employers are posting makes the rejection sharper.
Interview Questions: What salary are you looking for.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Florida in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic interview
Interview Questions: I dont have

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: a panel of 5 people with about 2-3 quesions from each. Questions concentrated on experience, projects, skillset , and career goals. Standard behaviroal questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflit with your collegues?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was cool, but not simple. I applied for a GA where work was related to programming and web development. Most question were based from my resume, the kinda work that I had done in past. Just be yourself.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions:
telephone interview with some behavioural questions
then techinical in 1:1
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: This was more a good interview experience at school level. I applied through University's employment website and got a call in 2 days. The interview consisted only 2 personals and it was very smooth and they were friendly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Biological Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: This job was for a facility lab tech in an academic institution.  I submitted my application by email and received a very nice reply from the lab manager.  I got a call about 2 weeks later for a phone interview.  It seemed to go fine but perhaps not outstanding though as I got a rejection letter by mail 2 weeks after that.  It could have been that I was slightly overqualified or perhaps that's what my ego would have me believe.  But this lab manager passed my resume on to a colleague of his who was hiring for another position in a company which I also ended up interviewing for.  So even though I didn't get the job it helped to get myself out there!
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position though it's in a slightly different field from what you do now?

title: Assistant Technical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Resume, phone interview, in person panel, presentation, in person direct report.
Interview Questions: Give an experience that was negative in the beginning in which you created a positive outcome...

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: it was great
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 year

title: Human Resources  Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of South Florida (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2007
Interview Descriptions: The application process was OK, except they didn't have an online applicant tracking system at the time (they have recently implemented one).  Normal interview process.  Took too long, though.  I had given up on them when I finally heard from them.
Interview Questions: I don't remember any of the questions.
